scene_description_enriched: Three men are depicted in a richly decorated interior. The man on the left wears a yellow robe with red trim and a white fur collar, and a green and red hat. He holds a framed tablet with Latin inscriptions. The man in the center, wearing a white turban and a fur-trimmed garment, also holds the tablet. The man on the right wears a blue tunic and a green hat, and holds a small white object. The background consists of vertical wooden panels. The tablet displays the Latin text "DNE NE IN FVRORE IVO A IN IRA TVA CORRIPIAS M", which translates to "Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger, nor discipline me in your wrath." This is a passage from Psalm 6, a penitential psalm often used for prayer and repentance.
